avalancheActivity.highlights: Spring conditions are in the mountains and the snow is considered uniform, isothermal and stable. Loose, wet avalanches may occur on steep solar aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: There is little snow in lowlands but spring conditions are present in higher elevations and inland with uniform and isothermal snowpack which is generally considered stable. People traveling in the mountains may trigger small, wet loose avalanches on steep solar aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thin slabs formed in the mountains this weekend. They might be unstable to begin with while the snowpack subsides and strengthens in mild weather and diurnal temperature fluctuations. Avalanches may release in the new snow due to the warming.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow is in the mountains and avalanches may release during warming. Underlying snow is generally considered homogenous and stable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðlægar áttir, hægur vindur og lítisháttar skúrir næstu daga. Milt í veðri og möguleiki á vægu næturfrosti.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the mountains after snow fall this weekend and small avalanches may release as a result. Underlying snow is isothermal and considered stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The new snow from the weekend is expected to form a weak bond with underlying snow to begin with. Small wind slabs may be found in places and avalanches may release as a result of warm temperatures and rain this week. Freeze-thaw cycles and melting of new snow will likely strenghten the bond between new and old snow this week. Underlying snowpack is considered isothermal, uniform and stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thin slabs formed in the mountains this weekend. They might be unstable to begin with while the snowpack subsides and strengthens in mild weather and diurnal temperature fluctuations. Avalanches may release in the new snow due to the warming.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow is in the mountains and avalanches may release during warming. Underlying snow is generally considered homogenous and stable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suð- og austlægar áttir og lítilsháttar skúrir með éljum til fjalla næstu daga. Milt í veðri og hægur vindur.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow has formed wind slabs on most aspects. Warming temperatures may cause avalanches to release on that layer between old and new snow to begin with until the new snow subsides.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow in the mountains from the weekend has formed small wind slabs on leeward slopes. New snow may not bond well with older firn and natural avalanches may occur during warming. People may trigger avalanches on steeper slopes. Underlying snow is considered relatively stable, uniform and isothermal. Snow showers on Thursday may form more wind slabs in upper elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thin slabs formed in the mountains this weekend. They might be unstable to begin with while the snowpack subsides and strengthens in mild weather and diurnal temperature fluctuations. Avalanches may release in the new snow due to the warming.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow is in the mountains and avalanches may release during warming. Underlying snow is generally considered homogenous and stable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt og úrkomulítið á þriðjudag en hvessir í SV-átt á miðvikudag og fram á fimmtudag með éljum til fjalla. Annars milt í veðri og næturfrost.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the mountains with wind slabs that may be unstable to begin with. Warming temperatures may cause avalanches to release.

snowpackStructure.highlights: new snow formed wind slabs on westerly aspects this weekend that may be unstable to begin with. Warming weather and diurnal temperature fluctuations will have a stabilizing effect on the snow pack. The underlying snowpack is homogenous, isothermal and stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thin slabs formed in the mountains this weekend. They might be unstable to begin with while the snowpack subsides and strengthens in mild weather and diurnal temperature fluctuations. Avalanches may release in the new snow due to the warming.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow is in the mountains and avalanches may release during warming. Underlying snow is generally considered homogenous and stable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg sunnanátt og skúrir á þriðjudag. Milt í veðri næstu daga og vægt næturfrost. Úrkomulítið á miðvikudag.
